dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5637 IH: Supporting Farmworker Mental Health Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Harder of California introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 to authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to authorize the use of certain grants to deliver peer-to-peer mental health support to individuals who are engaged in farming, ranching, farm work, and other occupations relating to agriculture.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Supporting Farmworker Mental Health Act.

paragraph.text: are vital to the economy and food supply of the United States; and
who are disproportionately affected by stress and anxiety, often lack access to behavioral health care services.

section.header: Farm and Ranch Stress Assistance Network
section.text: Section 7522 of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 5936) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting farm work, after ranching, each place it appears;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(D), by striking or at the end;
by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

paragraph.text: to initiate, expand, or sustain programs that deliver peer-to-peer mental health support to individuals who are engaged in farming, ranching, farm work, and other occupations relating to agriculture; or

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (3) (as so redesignated), by striking paragraph (1) and subsection (a) and inserting paragraphs (1) and (2) and subsection (a); and

paragraph.text: in subsection (d), by striking 2023 and inserting 2028.
